President of the United States|U.S. President Donald Trump is First impeachment of Donald Trump|impeached by the United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.
50 people are killed and thousands are left homeless by Typhoon Phanfone in the Philippines.
''New Horizons'' takes the first close up image of a 486958 Arrokoth|classical kuiper belt object.

Christchurch mosque shootings kill 51 people, while a 2019 Khash–Zahedan suicide bombing|suicide bombing in Iran kills 41, and a 2019 Sri Lanka Easter bombings|series of bomb attacks in Sri Lanka kills 250.
The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant loses the last of its territory.

Abdelaziz Bouteflika resigns as President of Algeria, while Omar al-Bashir 2019 Sudanese coup d'état|is deposed as President of Sudan in 2019 Sudanese coup d'état|a coup d'état amid 2019 Algerian protests|widespread protests 2018–19 Sudanese protests|in both countries.
Victor Vescovo breaks the human depth record, reaching 10,928 m in the Challenger Deep.
2019–20 Hong Kong protests|Protests begin in Hong Kong over an extradition bill.
2019 Amazon rainforest wildfires|Wildfires spike in Brazil, while Australia endures the 2019–20 Australian bushfire season|most widespread brush fires in its history.
''Avengers: Endgame'' was released in theaters, breaking many box-office records, including becoming the List of highest-grossing films|highest-grossing movies of all time.
Isabelle Holdaway is the first patient to receive a genetically modified phage therapy to treat a Antimicrobial resistance|drug-resistant infection.
Pope Francis abolishes Pontifical secret|pontifical secrecy in Catholic Church sexual abuse cases|sex abuse cases.
The 2019–2020 dengue fever epidemic begins in Southeast Asia.
Jair Bolsonaro becomes President of Brazil.
2019—20 Bolivian protests|Protests erupt in Bolivia 2019 Venezuelan presidential crisis|and Venezuela over 2018 Venezuelan presidential election|disputed 2019 Bolivian general election|elections.
Nursultan Nazarbayev resigns as President of Kazakhstan. Kassym-Jomart Tokayev assumes power. Astana is renamed Nur-Sultan in his honor.
The EU Directive on Copyright in the Digital Single Market is passed over intense opposition.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy becomes President of Ukraine.

Event: Bashar al Assad launches Northwestern Syria offensive (April–August 2019)|multiple offensives Northwestern Syria offensive (November 2019–present)|in Northwestern Syria; Turkey launches 2019 Turkish offensive into north-eastern Syria|an offensive into northeastern Syria.

Event: The United States blames June 2019 Gulf of Oman incident|attacks on ships in the Gulf of Oman on Iran, escalating tensions in the Persian Gulf.
Kyriakos Mitsotakis becomes Prime Minister of Greece.

Boris Johnson becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, and attempts a 2019 British prorogation controversy|prorogation of Parliament that is R (Miller) v The Prime Minister and Cherry v Advocate General for Scotland|ultimately declared unlawful.
Barisha raid ends in the Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi|death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.
2019 Albania earthquake|A 6.4 magnitude earthquake in Albania, kills 51 people.
Greta Thunberg delivers "How dare you" speech at the 2019 UN Climate Action Summit.
The United States Department of Justice|U.S. Justice Department charges Chinese tech firm Huawei with multiple counts of fraud.
WikiLeaks co-founder Julian Assange is Indictment and arrest of Julian Assange|arrested in London.
More than 50 prisoners are Amazonas prison massacres|killed in a series of riots in Amazonas (Brazilian state)|Amazonas, Brazil.

2019 Koreas–United States DMZ Summit|A trilateral gathering was held at the Panmunjom Truce Village between South Korean President Moon Jae-in, North Korean Leader Kim Jong-un and United States President Donald Trump.
Ursula von der Leyen becomes President of the European Commission.
United States v. Guzmán|Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán found guilty of drug trafficking, money laundering and murder and is sentenced to 30 years in prison.
2019–2020 Japan–South Korea trade dispute|Japan and South Korea trade dispute.
Death of Sahar Khodayari|Sahar Khodayari dies after setting herself on fire after being arrested for attending a soccer game in Iran.
Trial of Catalonia independence leaders|Twelve Catalan independence movement leaders found guilty of sedition and misuse of public funds and they were sentenced to 9 to 13 years in prison.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is indicted on charges of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
Sanna Marin becomes Prime Minister of Finland.
Assassination of Qasem Soleimani|Qasem Soleimani is targeted and killed at Baghdad International Airport.
Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 is shot down by Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) shortly after taking off from Tehran, killing all 176 on board.
Donald Trump is acquitted by the United States Senate in First impeachment trial of Donald Trump|his first impeachment trial.
A 2020 Calabasas helicopter crash|helicopter crash in Calabasas, California kills nine people, including basketball star Kobe Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna.
The United Kingdom Brexit|formally withdraws from the European Union.
Cyclone Amphan becomes the costliest cyclone ever recorded in the Northern Indian Ocean.
2020–2021 Belarusian protests|Protests in Belarus against the Alexander Lukashenko regime begin.
The murder of George Floyd sparks George Floyd protests|protests across the United States and the world.
Human spaceflight|Crewed spaceflight Crew Dragon Demo-2|resumes in the United States for the first time since 2011.

China's National People's Congress National People's Congress decision on Hong Kong national security legislation|grants itself sweeping powers to Hong Kong national security law|curtail civil liberties in Hong Kong.
2020–2021 Bulgarian protests|Protests begin in Bulgaria against the government of Boyko Borisov.
2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
Typhoon Goni leaves the Philippines and Vietnam devastated, with 32 deaths and US$415 million in damage.

The 2020 United States presidential election occurs. Despite the pandemic, early voting and other factors result in the highest voter turnout since 1900, and a record of over 155 million votes cast. Although Joe Biden is declared the winner on November 7, Donald Trump leads an Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|unprecedented effort to prevent official recognition of his defeat, culminating on January 6 the next year.
Typhoon Vamco lashes into Luzon, leaving 111 people dead.

The COVID-19 pandemic, which began spreading late in the prior year, spreads from China to the vast majority of the world's inhabited areas, infecting at least 81 million and killing at least 1.8 million people in its first year.

Fears of COVID-19 cause the Dow Jones Industrial Average to fall ten percent in one week, its largest drop in history, triggering the COVID-19 recession|COVID-19 Recession, the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.
The United States signs a tentative Afghan peace process|peace agreement with the Taliban.
Silurian millipede ''Kampecaris obanensis'', the oldest known land animal, is discovered in Scotland.
China and India engage in 2020 China–India skirmishes|border skirmishes, the largest escalation between the two powers in 50 years.
China launches Chang'e 5 and becomes the third country after the United States and the Soviet Union to return samples of the moon.
K-pop band BTS becomes the worldwide phenomenon due to the record setters of their music and influence on social media.
